posts.name: Ursa Major
posts.description: Ursa Major is a constellation in the northern sky, named after its resemblance to a great bear. It is one of the most recognizable constellations and contains the famous asterism known as the Big Dipper.

posts.name: Cassiopeia
posts.description: Shaped like a W or M, Cassiopeia is visible year-round but best seen in autumn and winter.

posts.name: Leo
posts.description: Representing a lion, Leo is prominent in spring and contains the bright star Regulus.

posts.name: Cygnus
posts.description: Also known as the Northern Cross, Cygnus is best seen in summer and autumn and features the bright star Deneb.
